name: jChat
tagline: A java based chat client and server
body:
### jChat (Originally jShare)
I started off jShare with plans to allow users connected to the server to share files or packages of files with anyone connected, well it ended up turning into a multi-user chat program.

### Usage
The intended use of jChat is anytime you want to chat with someone(s) running your own private server, with no chat logs so everything you say stays private.

### Features
#### Implemented
+Multi-user chat
+Email based user names
+Client GUI themes
+Gravatar based avatars(Automatically grabbed using users email)
+Color coded user names(Each new user is given a random color, making it easy to read and differentiate clients)
+Online user list
+Auto-updating client
+New message notifications
#### Planned
+File sharing
+Better notifications
+User registration
+Login using Google/Facebook/OpenId

+Private messaging



### Authors and Contributors
@bittiez is the Author and currently the only contributor to jChat.

### Support or Contact
Send @bittiez a message on GitHub for support, or open an issue [here](https://github.com/bittiez/jShare/issues).
